course_title: Special Topics in Latin American and Caribbean Studies: Caribbean Lit & Creative Writ
class_notes:
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


SAME AS AAS 385W 1 AND ENGCW 389W 1. Application required. Complete course atlas information (including texts and grading) and application form available on the Creative Writing Program website.


Caribbean Literature & Creative Writing: a Practicum of Fiction and Poetic Forms that Consider Black and Brown Bodies


This is a creative writing course that challenges Western and other traditionally received forms and methods of writing fiction and poetry, and asks if and how these forms have served in writing characters of color or characters from the non-Western world. The course methodology will be that of lecture, class discussion based on close reading, student presentation, and in-class workshop.  Students will write poetry and fiction.  Students will be required to write a craft paper on a particular form: chosen by the student and approved by the instructor.
